title: Money Expressions
description: Test your knowledge of idioms and phrases about money — from 'penny wise' to 'cash cow'!

questions.question: What does 'penny wise, pound foolish' mean?
options: Being careful with small amounts but wasteful with large ones
Saving every penny is always smart

questions.question: If something is a 'cash cow,' what is it?
options: A reliable source of steady income or profit
A piggy bank shaped like a cow

questions.question: What does 'money doesn't grow on trees' mean?
options: Money is not easily or freely available
Paper money is made from wood

questions.question: If you 'foot the bill,' what are you doing?
options: Paying the total cost of something

questions.question: What does 'break the bank' mean?
options: Cost more than one can afford

questions.question: If someone is 'rolling in money,' what is their financial situation?
What does 'a penny for your thoughts' mean?
options: An invitation to share what someone is thinking

questions.question: If you 'tighten your belt,' what are you doing financially?
options: Spending less and being more frugal

questions.question: What does 'bring home the bacon' mean?
options: Earn a living or income for the family
Win a prize at a fair

questions.question: If something is 'worth its weight in gold,' what does that mean?
options: It is extremely valuable or useful
It should be weighed on a scale

questions.question: What does 'nest egg' refer to?
options: An egg found in a bird's nest
A sum of money saved for the future
A golden egg from a fairy tale

questions.question: If someone 'pays through the nose,' what happened?
options: They paid far too much for something

questions.question: What does 'in the red' mean financially?
options: Owing money or being in debt

questions.question: If you 'make ends meet,' what are you managing to do?
options: Earn just enough to cover basic expenses
Meet friends at the end of the road

questions.question: What does 'put your money where your mouth is' mean?
options: Back up your words with action or financial commitment
